loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is 51 years old and married with ten children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Bebelyn is borrowing 19,500 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bebelyn has been raising pigs for twenty years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1952. She has four adult children who are workers and on the police force. Her husband raises doves. His income is about 5,000,000 VND. 

Ha raises pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 2,000,000 VND. She has been raising pigs for 25 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy food for her pigs. She wants to expand her farm of pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Syviline

texts.en:
Syviline works as a manicurist. She also sells cosmetics and all types of accessories.

Syviline is known in her neighborhood for her good work and her friendliness with people. She has worked at this job for two years, offering her clients excellent service.

The loan she is requesting from the Yehu Microfinance is for the purchase of accessories and cosmetics to sell, which will help her to continue working and earning income for her family. She is grateful for the help, because it allows her to grow in her undertaking as a small business owner.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Faisa

texts.en:
Faisa is widowed and works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Faisa is requesting a loan from NWTF for 11,500 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items to re-stock her store such as soap, toothpaste, bread, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc. In the future, Faisa would like to save enough money so her children can finish college.

loans.use: to purchase soap, toothpaste, bread, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: Corina de 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija. Corina posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. Doña Corina solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias. ella es una mujer responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Corina is 53 and lives with her husband and daughter. Corina has a store where she sells basic items: bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, bottled water, vegetables, and more. She is responsible and friendly and has a number of customers, even though she does not offer a wide range of merchandise.

Corina has applied for a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale. She wants to be able to stock more items and increase her income. She is a responsible woman who wants to offer her family the best.

loans.use: to buy beverages, eggs, basic grains, and more.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, age 40, is married with two children. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Arlene manages a retail store for a living. The work gives her a total monthly income of PHP 7,000. In 2012, she joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 from the cooperative to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She hopes to spare a portion of her earnings for maintenance costs and to expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Neslie

texts.en:
This is Neslie, 25, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. Her partner is Mark, a fish vendor and they have children. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Neslie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Neslie hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en: Manilyn is 25 years old and single with one child. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over three years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. She has joined in GDMPC to gain access to her retail business. Now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Her hope and dream is to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noe Israel

texts.es:
Noé es un joven soltero,  de 21,  años quien vive junto a sus padres en el municipio de Sololá.
Actualmente ha iniciado un negocio de venta y distribución de productos de consumo diario, esta actividad la realiza en las tiendas locales así como las que se encuentran en comunidades lejanas, realiza este tipo de actividad ya que le  genera ingresos aceptables y de esta manera aporta a los gastos familiares y para el sustento de sus estudios.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,250.00 para la compra de más abarrotes.
Su sueño es finalizar sus estudios en la universidad y así poder graduarse de Ingeniero Agrónomo  y formar una Familia.
texts.en:
Noé is a young single man. He is 21 years old and lives with his parents in the town of Sololá.

He has currently started a business selling and distributing essential goods. He does business with local stores as well as others located in distant towns. He went into this business because it generates an acceptable income and allows him to contribute to covering his family's expenses and pay for school.

He is requesting a GTQ 4,250 loan to purchase more groceries.

His dream is to pay his way through college, obtain a degree in Agronomy, and start a family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marcos trabaja para una cooperativa de transporte como chequeador de buses, tiene ocho años de laborar para esta empresa.
Es casado su esposa es ama de casada, tienen tres hijos, tiene casa propia.
El dinero lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacerle una habitación a su hijo.
El sr. Marcos se siente muy bien trabajar con ceprodel y kiva, ya que todos los crédito los ha aprovechado muy bien ha visto su crecimiento como persona como familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos works checking buses for a transportation cooperative. He has worked for this company for eight years. He is married and his wife is a housewife. They have three children and own their own home.

He is asking for money to buy construction materials to make a room for his son. Marcos feels great working with CEPRODEL and Kiva, as he has made very good use of all of the loans. He has seen his growth as a person and the growth of his family towards having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement and stone.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 53 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Lucy has been in this business for three years and sells items such as basic groceries and toiletries.

She requested a PHP 27,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to resell at her store, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, and noodles. In the future Lucy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to resell at her store, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 54 years old. He lives with his wife in Lusadzor village which is in the Ijevan area. His daughter is married and lives separately from parents with her newly created family. Sargis’ elder son is in the Russian Federation for work abroad, and his younger son is serving in the military. 

For a long period, Sargis worked as a worker in several factories in the city of Ijevan. 

Since 1992, Sargis and his wife have engaged in agricultural business. On his own plot of land, Sargis grows vegetables which he sells in Ijevan markets. He also breeds chickens. Sargis has built a chicken coop near his house and keeps about 50 chickens. Sargis has a lot of clients from Yerevan and sells them eggs once a week. The profit from his farming allows him to sustain his family. From time to time, his elder son helps Sargis and shares with his family from Russia. 

Sargis asks for a loan from Kiva to organize the spring seeding process and to buy young chickens in order to enlarge his agriculture business.

loans.use: To organize the spring seeding process and to buy young chickens

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1967. She has a son and a daughter. Her son is a construction worker. Her daughter is learning in secondary school. Her husband is also a construction worker. His income is about 4,000,000 VND. Lan sells fruits to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 18 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy fruits to sell in her stall. She always wants to expand her stall of fruits.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en: Maximo is a 56-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. She has three grown children. He operates a retail store. He sells goods like coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, soaps and seasonings. He has been operating a retail store for almost 20 years. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell like soft drinks, condiments, beverages and eggs. In the future, Maximo would like to expand his business to improve his livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like soft drinks, condiments, beverages and eggs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling used clothing.  Vilma is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and other equipment for her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marites has been in this business for 15 years, and she earns more income from fattening pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional fishing materials, like fishing net, bamboo, hooks, and wood, for her fishing business. Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials, like fishing net, bamboo, hooks, and wood

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 28 years old and married. She has two children, who are in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like soap, spices, shampoo, coffee, and sugar. Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like soap, spices, shampoo, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and works hard to support her family. For five years now she has sold fish in the Philippines.

Josephine is applying for a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a greater quantity of fish to sell. With her profits she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a married woman and the mother of four children.  She is from Bien Unido, Bohol.  Together with her husband, she has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 10 years now.  This is the source of their income. 

Cheryl is asking for a loan in order to buy a new boat engine and fuel.  Through this investment, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Cheryl hopes to expand their fishing business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fuel.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Epifania has been in this business for twenty years. Epifania earns additional income from raising livestock.

Epifania has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Felita

texts.en:
Felita is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has engaged in farming and a hog-raising business for more than five years. This is the source of her income. 

Felita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through the loan, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is from Voi. She is single and has been the owner of a beauty salon for more than two years. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who has the vision to move forward. Through her daily efforts she has been doing so.

Elizabeth is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through Yehu so that she can buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, crèmes, gels, shampoo, rinses and other items. This will allow her to provide her customers with excellent and high-quality service.

Elizabeth’s goals are to continue improving her business and help her relatives.

loans.use: buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 34 years old.  She is married and has two children.

Celia works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery items like snack foods, detergent bars and other groceries.  Prior to requesting this loan, Celia has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF.  She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Celia aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like snack foods, detergent bars and other groceries.

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
Rodalyn is 34 years old and she has three children.

Rodalyn works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 24,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell, including soap, canned goods, sugar and milk.  Prior to this loan, Rodalyn has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF.  She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from direct selling products from Natasha, a direct selling company carrying shoes, apparel, accessories and personal care products.

Rodalyn aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell including soap, canned goods, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Nyota

texts.en:
Nyota is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is a carpenter, and they work hard to better their lives as a family. They own a house with neither electricity nor piped water.

Nyota operates a business cooking dumplings for sale. Her clients are her fellow villagers .She is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to buy ingredients like wheat flour, sugar and salt and trays for the preparation of the dumplings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, sugar and salt and trays for the preparation of the dumplings.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years.

Isabel requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more fish to sell. She would like to save money, for future business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 57 years old and a widow. She has one kid who is in school. Lerma is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for four years, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business.

This time, she requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. Lerma would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married, and she lives in Voi. She has her own home, with comforts for the well-being of her family. 

Nancy works making bricks, which she has been doing for years. She comments that she works hard to give her family the best life possible, because they are her reason for being. One of her dreams is to be able to expand the area where she bakes her bricks. She is requesting the loan, which she will use for the purchase of indispensable materials for making bricks. She is very grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it is giving her.

loans.use: to purchase indispensable materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
This is Salvador, 53, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. He is married and a father to his children. He manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his family’s everyday expenses.

Salvador operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies like pens, bond paper, 'cartolina' and the like, without going to a bookstore. In his store, he also sells cell phone accessories. He gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy  pens, paper, fasteners, folders, envelopes and other school supplies.

Salvador hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams that his child will finish his studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for  pens, paper, fasteners, folders, envelopes and other school supplies.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha operates a 'khanga' (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. Apart from that she operates a green grocery to supplement her earnings. The previous Kiva loan helped her to boost her business and she appreciates the help.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: This time, Maribel is applying for a new loan of Php 19,500 to purchase medicines and vaccines for her livestock.  The motorcycle transport business that she previously funded through NWTF, Kiva's partner, continues to provide for Maribel and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Grethel Isabel

texts.es: Grethel de 33 años de edad, es casada madre de dos hijos uno de 10 y otro de 12 años, a quienes manda a la escuela para que se preparen y logren obtener una profesión, Grethel junto a su marido desea salir adelante con su pequeño negocio, la venta de pescados por libras ubicado en uno de los mercados de Managua, en una zona donde no presta las condiciones necesarias, pero esto no la desanima ya que es su único medio de ingresos. Solicita este crédito para comprar pescados y camarones, para ofrecer a la clientela que pasa, para obtener el sustento diario de la casa y que a sus hijos no les falten lo primordial la alimentación.
texts.en: Grethel, 33, is married and has two children, ages 10 and 12, whom she sends to school so that they can prepare for a profession. Grethel and her husband want their small business, selling seafood by the kilo in one of Managua's markets, to prosper. The area does not provide the proper conditions, but this doesn't discourage them, as the business is their only income source. Grethel has applied for a loan to buy seafood and shrimp to sell to customers so that they can provide food for their children every day.

loans.use: to buy seafood and shrimp.

loans.name: Campesinos De Tzununá 2 Group

texts.es:
Cruz es el líder del Grupo Campesino 2 (de camisa celeste con gorra negra en la fotografía) es un señor  de 40 años de edad quien  tiene 9 hijos quienes son 1 hombre y  8 mujeres.
El es caficultor, la siembra, mantenimiento y producción de café  lo realiza en su parcela, eligió esta actividad por su rentabilidad y lleva 20 años dedicándose a esta labor, de esta manera obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de fertilizante para el mantenimiento de su café.
Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia  en salud, educación y alimentación.
texts.en:
Cruz is the leader of the Campesino 2 Group (he’s the one wearing a blue shirt and black cap in the photo). He’s 40 years old and has nine children, one boy and eight girls.

He is a coffee grower, planting, maintaining, and producing coffee on his land. He chose this kind of work because it is profitable. It’s a job he’s been doing for 20 years and from it he earns the biggest part of his income with which to support his family.

Cruz is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer to spread on the coffee plants.

His dream is to improve his family’s standard of living in health, education, and food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to spread on his coffee plants

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel, 28, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past three years Liezel has had a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is applying for a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Liezel’s ambition is to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is 54 years old.  She is married and has two children.

Eda works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items to stock and sell.  Prior to this loan, Eda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF.  She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Eda aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to stock and sell.

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been engaged in fish vending business for more than 10 years now. 

Flordelisa is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and to pay the school fees of her children. Flordelisa has hopes of expanding her business and augmenting her income from it.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and to pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
This is Precilla, 36, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Joselito, a driver, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Prescilla operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and resell them to foundries, factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Prescilla hopes that her business will expand and dreams of having a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Campesinos De Tzununá 1 Group

texts.es:
Felix  es el líder del Grupo Campesino 1 (de camisa celeste, segundo de derecha a izquierda primera fila en la fotografía) es un señor  de 41 años de edad quien  tiene 5 hijos,  quienes viven en la aldea Tzununá,  departamento de Sololá.
El es caficultor, la siembra, mantenimiento y producción de café  lo realiza en su parcela, eligió esta actividad por su rentabilidad y lleva 20  años dedicándose a esta labor que heredo de su padre, de esta manera obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de fertilizante para el mantenimiento de su café.
Sueña con brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Felix is the leader of the "Campesino 1" Group (in the light blue shirt, second from the right in the first row in the photograph). He is a 41-year-old man who has 5 children. They live in the village of Tzununá in the department of Sololá.

He is a coffee farmer. He plants, maintains and produces coffee on his land. He chose this business for its profitability and has been making a living from this work he inherited from his father for the last 20 years. In this way he obtains the greater part of his income for sustaining his family. 

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the maintenance of his coffee. He dreams of giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the maintenance of his coffee

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián es un señor soltero de 42 años, tiene 7 hijos (3 hombres y 4 mujeres)  quienes viven en Sololá.
El se dedica a la compraventa de ropa típica desde hace 7 años, está actividad la ha heredado de sus padres y le ayuda a obtener ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, su producto lo vende tanto en la plaza de la localidad y fuera de ella.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para incrementar la variedad de productos que vende.
Uno de sus mayores sueños  lograr que sus hijos sigan estudiando para conseguir una profesión.
texts.en:
Julián is single man aged 42 with seven children, three boys and four girls. They live in Sololá.

He has earned his living for the past seven years buying and selling traditional clothing, a business he inherited from his parents. With the income he supports his family. He sells the clothing in the local plaza and also in the surrounding area.

Julián is seeking a loan of Q 3,000.00 to increase the variety of clothing he sells. 

One of his greatest dreams is to see his children continue their education so they can get good jobs.

loans.use: increase the variety of clothing he sells

loans.name: Claidy

texts.en: Claidy is 25 years old and single, living in Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He owns and manages a banana plantation for a living, earning PHP 4,000 a month from this farm. He borrowed PHP 7,000 from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer such as manure and pay for farm maintenance. Hopefully, he will be able to achieve his dream of expanding his farm for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure and to pay for farm maintenance

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet was born in 1965. She has a son and two daughters. Her son is a barber. Her daughters have their own families. Her husband raises pigs and mills rice. His income is about 3,000,000 VND. Tuyet raises pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy food for pigs. She always wants to expand her pigsty.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en: Freddie, 29 years old and married, lives in Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He owns and manages a banana and fruit tree farm, earning PHP 5,000 a month. Now he needs weeding maintenance so he decided to ask for a micro credit loan from GDMPC for PHP 7,000. In the near future, he dreams of having a well-developed farm.

loans.use: to pay for farm weeding maintenance

loans.name: Glady's

texts.en:
Glady's is married and has children. She buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. At first, they would buy the charcoal already packaged, but the business was able to expand its storage area, which can now store up to 15,000 kg of charcoal. They buy bags and polyurethane, package the charcoal, and sell to small businesses in the area. She makes her sales from a small cart.

Her business needs this loan to buy charcoal because of the increasing number of customers and the need to increase the amount of charcoal available to meet customer demands.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has a family and a general store in the Philippines. She makes additional money by buying and selling livestock and operating a motorcycle transport business.

Delia has already successfully repaid five loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a new loan of 11,000 PHP to further stock her general store with goods like soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, biscuits and other items.

She hopes her hard work will help her save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to further stock her general store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who lives at home and attends school. The family lives in a rented house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma sells clothes at the market to town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the uneven rate of sales which is affected by seasonal changes.

Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access their loans. She is applying for a 50,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy an additional bale of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy an additional bale of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos  es un joven soltero,  de 19  años de edad, quien vive junto a sus padres, en el caserío Vista Hermosa, municipio de Sololá.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura (siembra y cultivo de papa, zanahoria y coliflor) con lo cual genera ingresos que aporta para la economía familiar. Al momento de cosechar su cultivo la comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá. 
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de su siembra ya que en la época de invierno esto necesita más cuidado.
Su sueño más grande es poder construir una casa propia en donde pueda brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
19-year old Carlos is single and lives with his parents in the small village of Vista Hermosa, in the municipality of Solalá. He currently works in agriculture growing potatoes, carrots, and cauliflower. With the income he helps support his family. He sells the produce in the market in Sololá.

Carlos is seeking a loan of Q3,500.00 to buy agricultural products to put on the crops since in the winter they need lots of care. 

His greatest dream is to build a house of his own where he can provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Kimoeun's Group

texts.en:
A mother of seven from Pursat province, Kimoeun, age 47, supports the family by farming rice on a two-hectare rice field. Her husband also helps to support the family by working for others for a fee. The main problem for her business is the lack of working capital. 

Kimoeun is now on her third loan cycle with VisionFund and leading a group of three female members. She requested the loan to spend on land plowing for her rice field. She hopes the rice will produce a good yield and generate a good income so that she can fulfill her dream of having a small grocery store at home.

loans.use: To pay for land plowing

loans.name: Mafel

texts.en:
Mafel is 31 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Mafel works very hard to provide for them.

Mafel runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mafel has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Mafel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is from Voi and has a fruits and vegetables business. She sells from her home and around the town of Voi.

Rose says that she has been able to help her family through her business and that she has given them all that they need to continue having a dignified life with no deprivations. Rose wants to be able to continue working and helping her family, so she is asking for this loan to invest in fruits and vegetables to continue working and offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence wants to be able to invest in her business, which is buying and selling clothing and other items. She is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts and other garments to meet the high demand for these clothes in this season.

Clemence is grateful for this loan opportunity as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional hogs, and feed, vaccines, and vitamins for their proper growth.

loans.name: Ma. Flora

texts.en:
This is Ma. FLora, 44, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Robert, who works abroad. They have children. She manages their household while operating her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Flora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan to help her continue the operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Flora hopes that her business will continue to grow, and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a merchant; she makes a living selling mainly fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than ten years, and she has a place in a popular market in Samburu where she sells fresh products to her customers daily.

Veronicah is a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day starting very early in the morning, because she begins her work day very early.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Biharini

texts.en:
Biharini is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a food selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Amygail

texts.en:
This is Amygail, 29, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Charton, a construction worker, and they have children. Together with her partner, she manages their household, while at the same time she operates her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amygail operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go, to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece, at retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages, to expand her product inventory.

Amygail’s dream is for her business to expand and to have a good life.  She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Gloria has been in this business for nine years. Gloria earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred works hard to support her family. Mildred is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Mildred requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Mildred has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Mildred would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has a greengrocer business in Nyahururu. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy a larger stock of vegetables. She paid her previous loan on time. She hopes to expand her business with the anticipated profit.

In future, she hopes to open several branches of her greengrocery.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Crila

texts.en:
Crila works hard to support her family. Crila is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Crila requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to sell.

Crila has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Crila would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Naidan

texts.en:
Mr. Naidan, 66 years old, lives with his elder son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been working in the construction field for over thirty years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Four years ago, he began running his own building company. His company's service is known to be good and high-quality. Before he started his own business, he had a position as a construction engineer at a private business entity. His son now works for his company, as chairman of the construction team.

This year, Mr. Naidan's son's house burned down. The roof part has been completely removed, due to its not being re-usable. So he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase building materials, such as roofing shingles, vacuum-insulated windows, and bricks. Using these materials, he can repair his son's house and restore it to its original state, in no time. As a result, his son will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place. The borrower is a very hardworking individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Saponyo

texts.en:
Saponyo is 52 years old and lives at Naivasha. He is married to Margaret, and they have five children who are in school.

Saponyo is a farmer and has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm. He repaid his previous loan on time. With the anticipated profit from using this new loan, he hopes to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to be among the top farmers in his area, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Florencia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Florencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is married to Kahindi, and they have seven children.

Dama has been a vendor for five years. She has a stall in the market, where she sells fruits, vegetables, and novelty items. Her shop is well-stocked, and she has an established customer base. She says that she started small, when her children were babies and the economy was unfavorable. They get up very early to open their stall and to buy fresh produce, so that they can offer good quality to all their customers.

Today she is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, so that she can continue to offer her customers a good variety and to give them what they need.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sokkhoeun

texts.en:
Sokkhoeun is the mother of three and lives with her husband and children in her own house located in the Kandal province. Together with her husband, she makes a living by planting beans in their farmland of one hectare. They've been in this business for almost twenty years. 

This is Sokkhoeun's first loan with VisionFund. She requested the loan because of the lack of working capital to continue with her agricultural business. She will use the money from VisionFund to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her plantation, and gasoline for her water pump. She hopes to earn more money from these crops so she can expand her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizers, and gasoline for her farm.

loans.name: Orkhon

texts.en:
Mr. Orkhon, 34 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His thirteen-year-old son goes to school. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

Orkhon has been making and selling lattice walls to a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) manufacturing company because lattice walls are essential components for making ger. Lots of people living in urban areas are moving to Ulaanbaatar, which increased demand for the Mongolian traditional ger. 

So, Orkhon is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase timber in large quantity. Doing so will enable him to produce lattice walls continuously without worrying about inventory shortage. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase timber in large quantity.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 41-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of a 13-year-old daughter. 

Myrna is engaged in fishing. She sells fish to customers in her community. Her husband is a fisherman. He catches fish, crabs and sea shells. Myrna was the one selling her husband's catch. She has been into fishing for six years. 

Myrna requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing net to increase the volume of the catch. 

In the future, Myrna would like to expand her business to support her family and save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Originally from Prey Chor district, Neang lives with his wife and children in a thatched house. His family’s income totally depends on the agricultural business, especially cultivating rice. Having been in this occupation for more than 40 years, Neang, together with his wife, ensures good crop production and is able to generate an income of approximately KHR 15,000 per day. They usually use it to cover their daily expenses, including household bills and meals.

Neang currently needs a farm animal, which will help him in their rice paddy in the coming rainy season. In this connection, Neang is asking for a loan of KHR 2,300,000 to buy a cow for his farm work. He believes that someday his business will grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy a cow for his farm work.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is 33 years old, married, and has six children.  Her husband is a mason.  She sells fish, which she buys from fishermen, from her house. 

Luvuno is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more fish since they are in high demand and she would like to increase her stock.  She would like to expand her business and to have another shop in the outskirts of the town wholesale market, since her products are in high demand by her customers.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Lebrina

texts.en:
Lebrina, 27, is married to Jendrid, 28. They are blessed with three children, namely: Arny, 5, who attends first grade of elementary school; Ardan, 4, who attends kindergarten school; and Fadel, 2.

Currently, Lebrina has a business raising pigs, but she was thinking of starting a kiosk business. She has submitted a loan application to Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation (TLM) and has requested a loan in the amount of IDR 4,000,000. The loan will be used to buy building materials, such as zinc and wood, and also stock for the kiosk, like sugar, coffee, and tea. 

Lebrina hopes this new business will help her provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as zinc and wood, and also stock for the kiosk, like sugar, coffee and tea.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Mario  es un joven soltero,  de 19  años de edad, quien vive junto a sus padres, en el caserío Los Castro, municipio de Sololá.
Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de papa con lo cual genera ingresos que aporta para la economía familiar. Cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este trabajo. Eligió esta actividad porque para él es un trabajo honrado y rentable. Al momento de cosechar su cultivo la comercializa en el mercado local de Sololá. 
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de su siembra ya que en la época de invierno esto necesita más cuidado.
Sus dos sueños más grandes son introducir tecnología en la agricultura que realiza y por otro lado construir una casa propia en donde pueda formar una familia.
texts.en:
Mario is a young 19 year old man who is not married. He lives with his parents in the small village of Los Castro in the municipality of Sololá. 

He currently makes a living growing potatoes with which he generates earnings to support his family. He has five years of experience in this line of work. He chose this profession because it is honorable and profitable. At harvest he sells his crops in the local Sololá market. 

He is requesting a loan of Q 3,500 to buy agricultural supplies for planting maintenance because during the wintertime this requires greater care.

His two greatest dreams are to introduce technology into the agricultural work that he carries out and also to build his own house where he can create a family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: 02130501 Thôn 7- Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng is 39 years old and is married with three children. She supports three dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hồng operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork for resale.

In 2013, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of an eight-member group, the 02130501 Thôn 7-Hoằng Kim solidarity group.  

In the future, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase pork for resale.

loans.name: Ilchaizan

texts.ru: Ильчайзан жительница района Кумсангир. Ей 52 года. Она замужем и имеет двух взрослых детей. Ее муж, сын и дочь находятся на заработках за пределами страны. Ильчайзан занимается растениеводством. Сейчас она хотела бы заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. У нее имеется коровник для содержания скота и немного сбережение. Ильчайзан планирует каждый месяц закупать по 6-голов коров и телят, откармливать их в течение месяца и перепродавать на скотном рынке. Для того, чтобы реализовать свою цель и начать новый бизнес Ильчайзан обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Ilchaizan is a resident of the Qumsangir region.  She is 52 years old.  She is married and has two grown children.  Her husband, son and daughter are earning money outside the country.  Ilchaizan works in agriculture.  Right now she would like to start buying and selling cattle.  She has a cow shed for keeping livestock and some savings.  Ilchaizan plans to buy 6 cows and calves per month, to fatten them during the month and to resell them at the livestock market.  In order to achieve her goal and start the new business Ilchaizan applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en: Mamuna makes and sells fruit juice to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, as during rainy season the business is slow. With this Kshs 40,000 loan, she will purchase sacks of fruits to make fruit juice for sale. Mamuna decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits to make fruit juice for sale.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru: Фаррух холостой молодой человек. Ему 24 года. Он живет вместе с родителями в районе Кумсангир в южной части страны. Фаррух в данное время занимается земледелием. Однако его интересует животноводческая деятельность, так как это прибыльное дело. Он планирует закупать каждый месяц по 5-голов бычков, откармливать их в течение месяца и затем продавать с наценкой на скотном рынке. У него имеются все условия для содержания скота. Он обращается за кредитом с намерением начать свой новый бизнес и очень надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Farrukh is a young bachelor.  He is 24 years old.  He lives with his parents in the Qumsangir region in the south of the country.  Farrukh is currently a farmer.  However, he is interested in raising livestock as it is a profitable business.  He plans to buy 5 bulls every month, to fatten them during the course of the month and then to sell them for a markup at the livestock market.  He has the necessary conditions to raise livestock.  He is asking for a loan with the goal of starting a new business and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José tiene 57 años de edad, esta casado y  tiene cuatros hijos. Él se dedica al pastoreo, producción y comercialización de ganado y también hace 40 años se dedica a la agricultura. Él ganado lo compra en los tiangues dos veces por mes y recorre 35 kilómetros de distancia de su casa.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras. Lo que le permitirá mejorar la dieta alimentaria de su familia con la producción de leche y la elaboración de queso y también venderá estos lácteos. Con esos ingresos espera instalar el agua potable en su hogar. En un futuro desea exportar ganado a otros países, brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y comercializar lácteos en todo el país.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old, he is married and has four children. He makes a living herding, producing and selling livestock. He has worked in agriculture for the past 40 years. He buys the livestock in the market twice a month and he must travel 35 kilometres from his house.

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo is buy two milking cows. This will allow him to improve his family's diet with the production of milk and cheese and he will also sell these dairy products. With this income he hopes to install drinking water in his house. In the future he wants to export livestock to other countries, offer his family a better quality of life and sell dairy products all over the country.

loans.use: to buy two milking cows.

loans.name: Atagai

texts.en: Atagai is a 49-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Atagai needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Atagai will use the profits from her sales to improve her plantation, and to support her family and her children's education as well.

loans.use: to pay for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Don Gerardo de 54 años, vive en casa propia con su esposa, sus 5 hijo y sus nietos, aunque solamente uno de sus hijos depende economicamente de él. Es reconocido en la zona como una persona trabajadora y responsable, 
se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc y también posee un microbús donde realiza viajes, Don gerardo esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos cremas, perfumes, lociones, acondicionadores de cabello, shampoos, entre otras cosas para poder mejorar sus ventas y así mismo más ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica y darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Don Gerardo is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his wife, his five children, and his grandchildren.  However, one of his children is still financially dependent on him.  Gerardo is known in the area as a hardworking and responsible person.  

He sells perfumes, crèmes, deodorants, and other products.  Gerardo also has a microbus that he uses for making trips.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy more products such as crèmes, perfumes, lotions, hair conditioners, shampoos, and other items so that he can improve his sales.  At the same, he will have more income that will enable him to achieve better financial stability and to provide his family with what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, perfumes, lotions, hair conditioners, shampoos, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la cliente reside en casa propia con su compañero de vida. ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia tiene a la venta productos de primera necesidad. Es una mujer emprendedora, honesta y amable. Ella desea aumentar el inventario de su tienda con el fin de atraer a más clientes y mantener satisfechos a los que ya tiene. Solicita un credito para comprar variedad de insumos como: huevos, aceite, arroz, azúcar, leche, café, dulces, bebidas, detergentes, y otros productos que los clientes encuentren atractivos a la hora de realizar su compra y de esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client lives in her own home with her partner.  She set up a shop in her home where she has been selling essentials for a number of years.  She is an enterprising, honest and friendly woman.  She wants to increase her shop's stock so as to attract more customers and continue to provide satisfaction for her existing ones.  She is seeking a loan to buy a range of supplies such as eggs, oil, rice, sugar, milk, coffee, sweets, drinks, washing powder and other things which might appeal to her customers when they are shopping.  As a result, she hopes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, pan dulce (bread with a sweet topping), coffee, milk, egges, etc

loans.name: Lilliam Haydee

texts.es: La señora Lilliam Haydee M. T. habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en el barrio los Melendez. junto a su esposo y dos hijos, entre los dos se dividen los gastos del hogar ya que el trabaja para una casa empresa privada, sus  metas son terminar su casa donde habitan y mejorar de condiciones, desde hace 8 meses ella tiene un negocio que es la venta de Zapatos de Segunda, negocio que le ha resultado ya que tiene clientes quienes le comprar por encargos y clientes que compran al gusto, Con este credito comprara pacas de Zapatos para poder cumplir la demanda de los clientes, Agradece mucho a Afodenic quien en conjunto a Fondos Kiva la han apoyado.
texts.en:
Lilliam Haydee M. T. lives with her husband and two children in the Los Melendez neighborhood in the city of Ticuantepe. She and her husband share the household expenses, as he works for a private company. Their goals are to finish building and improving the house they live in. 

She has been selling used footwear for eight months and now has customers who place orders and others who buy when they see something they like. She will use this loan to buy bulk footwear to meet customers demand. She thanks Afodenic and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy bulk footwear to meet customers demand

loans.name: Roxana Yamileth

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de seis años de edad. Vive en casa de su hermana mayor. Desde muy pequeña creció junto a su familia, ayudándoles a lavar, elaborar la comida, la limpieza y planchar, pues siempre le ha gustado colaborar en la casa. Hace algún tiempo sus padres fallecieron y ella esta viviendo con su hermana mayor. Juntas iniciaron con el negocio de venta de lencería y ropa para todas las edades; ellas salen a vender casa por casa a vender este producto a todas las comunidades. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar lencería y ropa para todas las edades, especialmente en esta época de los madres quiere disponer de variedad de mercadería, porque el negocio es basta rentable. Y hoy en día se ha quedado sin mercadería porque su padrastro falleció y realizo varios gastos que no tenía previstos. Su sueño, es ahorrar para poco a poco ajustar para comprar un terreno y construir una casa de adobe.
texts.en:
Roxana is 28 years old and a single mother of a six-year old girl. She lives in her older sister's house. Starting at a young age, she grew up together with her family, helping them clean, prepare food, do the cleaning and ironing, so in that way she has always liked helping out around the house. Some time ago her parents died and she is living with her older sister. Together they started the business of selling undergarments and clothing for all ages. They go house to house to sell their products, in all of the communities. 

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Camp is to purchase undergarments and clothing for all ages, especially in this season she wants to have a variety of merchandise, because the business is very profitable. Today she has been left without merchandise because her stepfather died and she had various expenses that she did not anticipate. Her dream is to save little by little in order to purchase land and build an adobe house.

loans.use: to buy undergarments and clothing for all ages, especially during this season she wants to have a variety of merchandise, because her business is very profitable.

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
El señor Wilfrido  tiene 33 años, está casado  y junto con su esposa tienen un puesto de ventas de termos, ropas y calzados en general en una galería muy concurrida de la ciudad de Encarnación, en el cual atiende su esposa. El aparte se dedica a la confección de conjuntos de prendas para la venta al por mayor y menor, tienen un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, el cual con mucho esfuerzo están trabajando.
El Señor se dedica a este trabajo hace mas de 5 años, y cuenta que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y son muy solicitadas por sus clientes.
El Sr. Wilfrido quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, ya que este es el mayor sustento de su familia, y quiere poder comprar telas para seguir con sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Wilfrido is 33 years old and married.  Together with his wife he has a stall where he sells clothing and undergarments in a very busy market in the city of Encarnación.  His wife also works there.  The pair works making outfits to sell in bulk or individually.  They have a small sewing shop in their home in which they work with great energy.

Wilfrido has been working in this field for five years and he says that he can now count on a very good customer base.  His products are of very good quality and they are very sought after by customers. 

Wilfrido wants to continue investing in his business since this is the main way he provides for his family.  He wants to be able to purchase fabrics in order to continue with his sewing projects.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Del Pilar, nombré elegido en honor a su Santa Patrona; ellas están en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. En la foto del grupo aparecen 16 señoras, ya que en el grupo hay mujeres que no retiran créditos, pero forman parte del grupo.
Gloria, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella tiene todo tipo de ellos, ya que siempre ofrece muy buena variedad a sus clientes. Ella gracias al esfuerzo que hace día con día esta pudiendo ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de todo tipo, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas y también atraer a mas clientas.-
texts.en:
This group is called Del Pilar, a name chosen in honor of their Holy Saint. These women are in their first cycle of the women's committee program, where they work and help each other get ahead. These are very hard working women who want to help their families through work. In the photo there are sixteen women shown because within the group there are women who do not take out loans but still make up a part of the group. 

Gloria is one of the group's members and she makes a living selling cosmetics. She sells all kinds of these products and always offers a good variety to her customers. Thanks to the effort that she puts in each day, she is able to help her family and give them all that they need so that they are not lacking any basic needs. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of all kinds of cosmetics. With this loan she will be able to continue with her sales and also attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma has been running her tailoring business for more than fifteen years and her retail store for seven years.  She is thankful because through her hard work and support of her husband, she was able to improve her small businesses, as well as their living conditions.  

Vilma is 38 years old and happily married. The couple work hard in order to earn a living. Vilma wishes to sustain the smooth flow of her tailoring and retail store businesses, but she needs additional capital. With this, she is now asking for the financial support of Kiva lenders through ASKI in the amount of PHP 12,000. She will use the loan to buy stocks of garments for her tailoring business and different commodities for her variety store. She believes that through their support, she could further improve and make her businesses profitable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of garments for her tailoring business and grocery items for her retail store.

loans.name: Sukhtsetseg

texts.en: Sukhtsetseg, 46, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been selling clothes at a trade center by renting a stall since 2007. Before this job, she was working as a saleswoman for another person. Her husband works on contract with an oil extracting company. Her elder child studies at the university, while her younger child goes to high school. She is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to purchase clothes from China, as she has sold most of her current stock. As a result, she will be able to keep running her business without worrying about an inventory shortage. She will also be able to generate more income for her family, as demand for clothes usually increases during this period of time. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes from China.

loans.name: Gladys Marina

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y a las labores agrícolas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, pago de alquiler del terreno y pago de mano de obra para cultivar maíz. Su deseo es poder cultivar para obtener ingresos que le permita ayudar a su nieto así como ha ayudado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys, 50, is the single mother of two children.  She does the housework and works in agriculture.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy agricultural inputs, to pay rent on her plot of land, and to pay for labor to grow the corn.

She hopes to be able to farm to earn income to help her grandson, just as she has helped her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, to pay rent on her land, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work along with his wife.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 35 years old and married to Mumbo. She buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. She used to buy the charcoal already packaged but she was able to expand her storage area and she can now store up to 15,000 kg of charcoal. She buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells to small businesses in the zone. She makes her sales from a small cart. 

She needs this loan to buy more charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet her demands.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five grown children. She's engaged in farming and has been farming rice for 20 years. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and to pay for house renovations. This will help Rosalina increase her volume of harvest. In the future, Rosalina would like to expand her business to support her family and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for for house renovations

loans.name: 02130602 Thôn Hiệp Thành _Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mùi has a retail grocery store business. She is requesting a loan to purchase general things such as milk, sugar, candy, and biscuits to resell.
Mùi is 34 years old and she is married with two children.
She is the leader of a five-member group, the 02130602 Thôn Hiệp Thành _Hoằng Kim solidarity group. 
Mùi supports her dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Mùi first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Mùi has been involved in this business for eight years.
The main hardship that Mùi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Mùi hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase general things such as milk, sugar, candy, and biscuits to resell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is glad about the progress the business is making. Besides the café, she has been able to set up and manage a tailoring shop which currently employs one person.

Joyce looks forward to a good business season ahead and would like to improve the café. She is therefore asking for a loan of KES 41,900 to install new chairs and tables in the café.

loans.use: to install new chairs and tables in the café.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert emigrated from Guatemala to the United States in 1995 with his parents. He was 17 years old. Herbert worked for several supermarkets and grocery stores, but also went through several layoffs. 

As the child of a family with a business background, Herbert always wanted to start his own business. He worked part-time in a gas station to put himself through truck driver training classes, hoping to start a transportation business. After graduation, he worked as a driver for someone else for six years to get the experience.  

Now, Herbert wants to start his own trucking business to better raise his three children and care for his aging parents. He needs money for a down payment on a truck. He tried several banks, but because this is a start-up, he wasn’t able to secure a loan. Eventually, he learned about PACE from a friend. With a $10,000 PACE Kiva loan, he will be able to make a down payment on a truck.  

Herbert hopes his new venture will help him to put his three children into college and give his parents a better life to live.

loans.use: to make the down payment on his first truck.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. He has three children and has been farming for three years. His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

He stated that collecting eggs is the most enjoyable part of farming while his biggest challenge is expensive poultry feed.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Ngogaik.'

Simeon was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Juhudi Kilimo Loan Officer outreached to me'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Improved farming methods makes one pay the loan with ease.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family?', Simeon replied 'his cash flow will increase hence ease paying of school fees.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Simeon owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Bikombo

texts.en:
Bikombo is a married woman with one child who attends school and is under her care. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business from her home, serving her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and lack of enough capital. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth material, threads and needles for sewing clothes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material, threads and needles for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married, and she works hard to support her family.
