She used to work as an accountant, too, but she was attracted to clothes sales more. She wanted to take the challenge and find out how much she could expand her business and increase her income.

She is well known in her region, and with her good reputation and hard work, she is also known for her competitive prices and the quality of products provided to customers. 

Diala is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase her merchandise with a special summer collection and competitive prices. She is very excited about this loan, and she is sure that it will bring a very positive impact on both her social and financial situations.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a special summer collection and competitive prices.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
Thon, a resident from the Moung Russey district in the province of Battambang, is a 41 year-old woman who is blessed with four children. Three of her children are still in school. 

For her family’s sake, Thon grows rice on three hectares of land as a source of their income. Her husband provides support also. After 10 years of being involved in her current business, she is able to earn up to 21,700 KHR per day. 

This is the third loan for Thon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully paid back, gradually enabled her to support her business and earn a living. Now, she is the leader of a group of three to apply for a new loan. 

The total amount of her group loan is 1,800,000 KHR of which 200,000 KHR is her loan portion. Thon will use her loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to boost her crop output so that she can make more money to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Nimrezzi

texts.en:
Nimrezzi has a fish-selling business, which she has operated for more than four years. She says seasonality is her main business challenge. She also operates a business selling firewood. Nimrezzi dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 30,000, Nimrezzi would like to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates the help.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Pheoun's Group

texts.en:
Phoeun is 54 years old and a widow. She resides in the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province. She counts on a single business, rice farming, to support the family’s sustenance. She has been involved in the current business for 14 years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she and other three joint members in the same group are in their third loans. She has managed to use her past loans wisely to improve her family’s living status and relieve its burden. Now, she is seeking 600,000 KHR; this is the same amount as her joint members. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed and pigs to raise for extra income. She hopes to raise her pigs healthily and sell them at high prices so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Kakvey's Group

texts.en:
Kakvey, a married mother of four children, is a rice grower from Battambang province where her residential area is. Her rice farm covers a one-and-a-half-hectare area. 

With 10 years' engagement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 32,500 KHR per day. Kakvey has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five cycles and has completely repaid her past loans, which have upgraded her living status gradually and provided decent daily food for her children. 

For this cycle, she forms a group of six to apply for a new loan. Two members including her are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while the remaining four members are seeking 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland and to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland. She hopes that she can triple her yield so that she can improve her living at a good pace.

loans.use: To plow her farmland and to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is 43 years old and she is happily married to Frankline. God has blessed them with loving children who are all still studying. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well, and they are helping each other by working for their family.

Rowena owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community. The store is connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, an egg or other items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns about Php300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of Php15,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help in aiding her to add more products to her store.

Rowena’s dream is to have a supermarket someday, and she hopes that her family will always be happily together. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mockline

texts.en:
Mockline lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a greengrocery, a business which she has been operating for five months. Mockline is also formally employed, and she sells charcoal, too. She sells tomatoes, sugar and onions, etc. in this business.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are bad debts and the high cost of transport while sourcing for the goods. Even then, she believes she can overcome them. 

Mockline is applying for a loan of 63,850 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal, vegetables and fruits at wholesale prices. She will improve her lifestyle from the extra income.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, vegetables and fruits at  wholesale prices.

loans.name: Bunthoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Bunthoeurn is 30 years old and a single man from Battambang province, where rice farming is the common business in the area. Not different from his neighborhood, he also does rice cultivation on a 1.5 hectare area. He is able to earn up to 33,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business that he has been with for five years. 

Buntheourn, a seven-time borrower, formed a group of two with a second-time borrower in order to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has wisely utilized his past loans and has fully repaid them with success. The past loan has enabled him to support his business on time and return him a decent profit, better than last year. 

Now, he and his joint member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. For Bunthoeurn as the leader, he will spend his loan portion to pump water and buy potash for his rice field. He hopes to earn more income so that he can set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: To pump water and buy potash for his rice field.

loans.name: En

texts.en:
A young mother of one little child, En is 25 years old and a rice grower and a bamboo vendor residing in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. With three years' engagement in the current business, she is able to earn up to 16,800 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for En with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy a plot of farmland to grow more rice and buy more bamboo for resale. She hopes to earn more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to grow more rice and buy more bamboo for resale.

loans.name: Thim's Group

texts.en:
A peasant from the Bovel district of Battambang province, Thim is 22 years old and has one small child to care for. She depends on corn growing as her main source of income. To supplement the family’s income, her husband works for others for a fee. The current business has returned her about 33,200 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Cambodia), Thim is in the first cycle loan. She leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 4,000,000 KHR. Thim, whose loan portion is 1,500,000 KHR, will spend it on plowing fees, corn seed, potash, and insecticide purchasing. She hopes that she can earn more income so she can set aside some money as a reserve to send her child to school.

loans.use: To spend on plowing fees, corn seed, potash, and insecticide.

loans.name: Kimhun's Group

texts.en:
Kimhun, 24 and a mother of one little son, is a local citizen from the Bovel district of Battambang Province. 

For sustenance for the family, she grows corn on a five-hectare area with support from her husband. She has engaged in the current business for four years. 

This is the first microloan for Kimhun's group, consisting of two female members who are applying for 1,500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for fertilizer, insecticide, seed, and plowing fees. She hopes to earn a high corn yield and make more income to improve her living.

loans.use: To fertilizer, insecticide, seed, and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: 02130603 Thôn Hiệp Thành _Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huê operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase meat for resale. 

Huê is 50 years old, and she is married with four children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 02130603 Thôn Hiệp Thành _Hoằng Kim solidarity group. Three of her children are grown up, so Huê supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huê's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Huê has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Huê hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase meat for resale.

loans.name: Chanleak's Group

texts.en:
Chanleak, 35, is married and has three children. She is a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support her living, she does rice farming and corn growing as the main source of family income. She has been involved in the current business for 10 years. 

Chanleak is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan was the first loan with VisionFund. She has completely repaid her past loan with success, and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle in a gradual manner. 

Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total loan amount of her requested loan is 3,600,000 KHR (Cambodian riels). As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for labor. She hopes that she will gain a good yield, better than last year's.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
For 15 years now, Editha has been farming rice for her family's needs. She and her family live in Ubay, Bohol. She has nine children, ages 9 to 25 years old. Editha is asking for a loan to buy  fertilizer and seedlings to maintain her farm. This will keep her crops healthy and will assure a better yield every four months.

In the future, she hopes to grow her farm and cultivate more land to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak, 56 years of age, is a mother of eight children, six married children and two single children who live with her in Prey Chor district and always help her in farming. Prak owns and operates a farming business, from which she can earn approximately 10,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) each day. She uses the income for basic necessities for her family. 

She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to KHR 2,000,000 to purchase farming materials to apply on her crops. With this loan, she will be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other materials needed to improve her farm. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will further improve her business as well as her living status.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials to apply on her crops.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Herminia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: agricultura, venta de ganado porcino y ovino, venta de comida, venta de ganado vacuno, elaboración de colchones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Herminia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de colchones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña al ayudar a su madre y al casarse decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a los comerciantes que venden por menor. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The ‘Nuevo Amanecer’ (New Dawn) communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Focal Center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Herminia is the president.  The members’ business activities are varied and include farming, selling pigs and sheep, selling food, selling cattle, and making mattresses.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Herminia is a member.  She says that this is the first time she has been a part of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who went to visit Herminia at her house.  She currently has a business making mattresses.  She explains that she learned this business when she was a young girl helping her mother.  When Herminia got married she decided to undertake the business independently.

The loan that she will now take is to increase capital (to buy fabric) that she will get at the stores in the city of El Alto.  After making the mattresses she will sell them to the wholesale merchants.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible.  She is married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings about health and loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Savour's Group

texts.en:
Savour, age 42 and married, is a local villager from Battambang province. She has four children, two of whom still rely on her as they are still in school. Four hectares of rice crops are her main source of income; it's the business which she has been with for 20 years. 

Including this loan, she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loan cycles. She has managed to provide decent food for her kids from the decent income received from the positive impact of her past loan, which she has fully repaid. Now, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR (Cambodian riels). She leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland. She hopes to improve her living conditions, better than before.

loans.use: to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Chhoeurt's Group

texts.en: An inhabitant from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Chhoeurt is married and blessed with two children. He is a carpenter who makes wooden tables, cabinets, beds, and other furniture as the main source of his income. To earn extra income, he also catches fish for resale. He has been involved in his current business for ages. Chhoeurt has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. He is now partnering  with another first-time borrower to apply a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy necessary materials to support both of his businesses. He hopes to earn more income to sustain his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to support both of his businesses.

loans.name: Somarin's Group

texts.en: A 51-year-old widow from the Sangke district of Battambang province, Somarin is a vendor who sells grilled chicken in order to support her two out of six children, as they are still in school. She has been engaged in her current business for three years. She and her partner are the second-time borrowers with VisionFund Cambodia. She feels confident that she can improve her living status gradually after the past loan which she has repaid with success. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR, the same loan amount as her partner is requesting. She will spend her loan portion as a leader to buy more chicken to grill and resell. She hopes to earn more income so that she can expand her business and upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to grill and resell.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
For the past years, Zainabu has operated a cosmetic shop as well as a food stall, selling from home. This provides her another source of income. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of cosmetics and food for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of cosmetics and food for resale.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Yungaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE YUNGAQUI II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria ella es casada y tiene 31 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de leche y queso, la socia vende en las diferentes ferias y también vende en el mercado, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene en este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar tortas para sus hijos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar queso y leche.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ganados, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers are members of the communal bank “Inmaculada Concepción de Yungaqui II”, located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Thirty-one year old Gregoria is a member of the bank and is married with 2 children. She works selling milk and cheese at different festivals and markets. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. She has been running this business for 8 years and it has been going very well. During her free time she likes to prepare pastries for her children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cheese and milk. The other members' businesses include selling animals, selling cattle, a grocery store and farming. 

Gregoria thanks those who form a part of this dream by way of this loan and she is committed to making her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy cheese and milk.

loans.name: Aníbal Isaí

texts.es:
Aníbal tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Aprendió el oficio de la agricultura desde la edad de los 10 años; ya que tenía que ayudar a su padre en las labores agrícolas. Para llegar al terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos tiene que caminar dos kilómetros y transportar los insumos en caballo. Cuando es la siembra de maíz los transporta en estacones de madera ya que por las altas pendientes del terreno no se puede utilizar tractor o bueyes; pero sus cosechas son igual de buenas que en los terrenos planos.  

Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, aborda un autobús en su comunidad en las faldas de un cerro de ahí viaja unos treinta minutos hasta                               

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizantes, un galón de herbicidas, 50 libras de semilla de maíz, entre otros insumos para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. La inversión le ayudara para que su cosecha tenga los insumos a tiempo y en la cantidad apropiada para obtener buenos resultados y poder construir una casa de ladrillo para que sus hijos vivan mejor.
texts.en:
27-year old Aníbal is married and has two children. He’s been involved in agriculture since he was 10 years old as he had to help his parents work their land. To get to the fields where he grows his crops he has to walk two kilometres and carry supplies on horseback. When he plants the corn, he transports it on wooden stakes as the steep slopes make it impossible to use either a tractor or oxen. His harvest is just as good as that from flat fields.

When Aníbal needs to buy supplies for his farm, he travels 30 minutes by bus from his hillside community.

The loan he is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy six bags of fertilizer, a gallon of herbicide, 50 pounds of corn seed, and other supplies for his 14,000 m2 land. The money will help him obtain the necessary supplies in time and in sufficient quantities to ensure a good harvest. He will also be able to build a brick house so that his children can live more comfortably.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, seeds etc for his farm

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis has been involved in agriculture for 16 years. He keeps chickens and grows peaches, plums, strawberries, apples, and pears. He gets income by growing gillyflowers and selling it to  the local flower resellers. 


This agricultural income is very important for Sargis to sustain the family of six: Sargis, his parents, his wife, and two children.

Realizing that agriculture is the only source of his income, Sargis would like to expand his agricultural activities. He has requested this loan to purchase chickens and special forage for feeding them. This will enable him to gather more income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for chickens and special forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Ismaelita

texts.en:
Ismaelita is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is from San Miguel, Bohol, and she is engaged in retail sales of cosmetics and fashion accessories to the people in her area. This is the source of her income. 

Ismaelita is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetics and fashion accessories to sell to her customers. With this loan, she will be able to sell more and earn more. In the future, Isamelita hopes to make her business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and fashion accessories to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jose Hilario

texts.es: Don jose de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa propia, don jose es un hombre trabajador y responsable, desde hace varios años se dedica a la produccion y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita
texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old and lives with his wife and child in his own home. Jose is a hard-working and responsible man. For many years, he has worked in the production and sale of milk products in the area where he lives. He has a good clientele since he has known how to gain the confidence of his customers. He offers quality and good prices for his products.

He has decided to invest in the care of his livestock since his business depends on that. Because of this, he has applied for a loan to be able to buy vitamins for the livestock and adjust for the purchase of a milk cow that will allow him to grow his business. With this, he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue providing economic help to his household, which needs it so much.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins for livestock and to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Carlos  está en su ciclo número  13 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual es una herramienta que permite conocer a las personas su situación en todas sus dimensiones. En este grupo, tres de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, por lo que se están esforzando por salir adelante.
La Sra. Feliciana tiene 43 años se dedica a la cría de animales para vender y también para su consumo. Ella tiene una pequeña granjita en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, cuida a sus animales y ve que no les falte nada. Sus hijos pequeños le ayudan para cuidar y vender, y de esa forma la familia entera pone mucho esfuerzo por salir adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, como ser afrecho, avezan y maíz, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y dando a sus crías lo que necesita. Agradece por esta ayuda que le ayudará a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The San Carlos group, a committee of women, is in its 13th cycle in the program.  They are doing an inquiry into the elimination of poverty, which is a tool that allows them to get to know all dimensions of a person's situation.  In this group, three of them are below the poverty line, and because of this they are working hard to get ahead.

Feliciana is 43 years old and works in raising animals to sell and also for consumption.  She has a small farm where she works each day starting very early.  She cares for her animals and makes sure they aren't lacking anything. Her small children help her to care for them and sell them, and in this way the whole family exerts a lot of effort to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her animals, which will be bran and corn, with which she will be able to continue working and giving her animals what they need.  She is thankful for this help that will allow them to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals, like bran and corn.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
Laureana nació en la comunidad de Pitumarca(Cusco, Peru) pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 
Laureana tiene 47 años de edad y es casada de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de refrescos y ropa, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad donde vive. Ella en sus horas libres también se dedica a la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, colorantes artificiales, frutas y otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Laureana was born in the Pitumarca (Cusco, Peru) community but now lives in the city of Salvación. The city of Salvación is located in the district of Manu in the province of Manu within the department of Madre de Dios, Peru.

Laureana is 47 years old and is married with four children. She is a hard working and entrepreneurial mother who is moving her family forward. Her main economic activity is the sale of soft drinks and clothing. She has a small stand in one of the markets of the city where she lives. She always spends her free time working in agriculture. She has had this business for several years and sees that it is going very well for her thanks to the perseverance that she puts forth in her work. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Tesoritos del Manu" (Little Treasures from Manu) and needs a loan now to buy supplies including sacks of sugar, artificial colorants, fruits and other items. She is thankful for the loan and values its worth. She is committed to paying her monthly loan installments.

loans.use: to buy supplies including sacks of sugar, artificial colorants, fruits and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y ganaderia,la socia se dedica al negocio de venmta de verduras y frutas,animales menore y chicha de jora que es una bebida a base de maiz,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y leva muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus pequeños negocios.La socia solcita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su tierras de cultivos.

La socia agracede a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Aurelia continues working in the business of agriculture and livestock. She works in the business of selling of vegetables and fruit, young animals, and chicha de jora, which is a corn-based drink. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Aurelia has already worked for 7 years in this business and it goes well for her. Aurelia’s dream is to grow her small businesses. She is applying for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cultivated land. 

Aurelia is thankful to those who make up a part of this dream through this loan and promises to complete her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Coka - Kiwalani Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her early 30s, is a single woman with two children who are in school. For a period of five years now, Rehema has been running a mamalishe (restaurant) offering different food services. She is doing fine in her project and family also. She depends on this field to meet her daily needs. Rehema works from 8 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a small profit each month. 

This will be Rehema's ninth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Having successfully repaid her previous loans, she managed to increase her stock of food. With the returns, she covered school fees for her children as well as household expenses. Rehema will use this loan to purchase the foods she needs in her mamalishe (restaurant). She dreams of the possibility of one day owning a nice hotel. 
 
Rehema will share this loan with her loan group, Coka-Kiwalani, which has 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase the foods she needs in her mamalishe (restaurant)

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a hardworking and enterprising person who has the vision to move forward. Through her daily efforts, she has been able to accomplish this. Her goal is to continue growing and helping her family.

Miriam is requesting this loan to start another business - a beauty salon. With the loan she wants buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, cremes, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items. This will allow her to provide her customers with excellent and high-quality service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, cremes, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items.

loans.name: Antero

texts.es: Antero tiene 38 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador , su casa es propia y vive acompañado de su mujer y sus dos hijas.Su actividad principal es el comercio, él compra carne y lo vende en un puesto que tiene en el mercado,  hace 10 años que viene dedicándose a este negocio,  se inicio gracias a un grupo de socios del mercado quienes lo invitaron a trabajar con ellos, y viendo que era rentable se animo a colocar su puesto . El problema antes de tener este negocio, era la falta de trabajo, solía tener solo trabajos eventuales y no uno fijo.Aparte de la venta de carnes, Antero tambien alquila terrenos para hacer chacra y sacar a la venta diferentes productos tales como yuca , maiz , entre otros .Antero espera seguir creciendo con su negocio y comprar otro terreno para sus sembríos,para que así nunca le falte trabajo. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy emocionado y agradecido por el apoyo económico financiero recibido además se compromete a ser responsable y puntual con sus pagos.Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500.00 soles comprara carnes para su negocio y pondra sus terrenos de cultivo en mantenimiento .
texts.en:
38-year old Antero is a hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his wife and two daughters. He works mainly as a businessman buying and selling meat from a stall he has in the market, a business he’s had for ten years. He began when a group of people from the market invited him to work with them; when it proved to be profitable, he invested in a stall.

Before starting this business, Antero had a problem finding work. The only work he could find was casual labour, nothing permanent. 

As well as selling meat, Antero rents land on which he grows and then sells different types of produce such as yuca, corn etc. He hopes to grow his business and also buy land for his crops so that he always has a job. 

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is very excited and grateful for the financial assistance. He promises to be responsible and punctual with the repayments. With the S/.2,500 soles he plans to buy meat for his business and agricultural supplies to maintain his fields.

loans.use: buy meat, as well as supplies for his farm

loans.name: Heap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang province, Heap is 61 years old and a married mother of five children. The rest of her family depends on a single business, rice farming, which Heap has been doing for 10 years. 

A new client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Heap leads a group of three to apply for a new loan.  She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each, while the third member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, Heap will spend her loan portion to buy five sacks of rice seed and gasoline for her mini-tractor for plowing her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so that she can expand her business gradually.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of rice seed and gasoline for her mini-tractor for plowing her farmland

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, 39, is married and a mother of two school-aged children. She is a local villager from Battambang province. For Sinat, rice farming and pig raising are the core income generating businesses to support her household. She has engaged in the current business for 15 years. 

Sinat's previous loan was her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed to use her past loan wisely to support her business seasonally and relieve her family’s burden better than before. Now, Sinat forms a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pump water for her rice field. She hopes to increase her income so that she can keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pump water for her rice field

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder medir los ingresos de cada una, donde dos de las quince señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, están luchando por crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edith, quien en su encuesta arrojo un nivel de ingreso muy bajo. Es justamente por esto que se esfuerza al máximo por seguir creciendo y mejorando. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, y cuenta que tiene todas las ganas de ir creciendo para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirla en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende, y así por medio de sí y trabajo ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The group named Mujeres Unidas is in its first cycle of the program of women’s committee. They are making the survey for the elimination of poverty to be able to measure the income of each one. Two of the fifteen women find themselves below the poverty line. They are struggling to grow and come out ahead.

One of the members is Edith, whose survey resulted in a very low income level. Is it precisely because of this that she makes a maximum effort to continue growing and improving. She makes a living selling food, and says that she wants to grow to improve her life and that of her family.

She is applying for this help to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables, meat, condiments, and other supplies to be able to continue making the foods that she sells. Through means of herself and her work she continues improving the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El Señor Lorenzo tiene 56 años, es separado, vive en la Ciudad de Villarrica, es padre de una nena llamada Francisca a quien adora. Él comenta que se dedica a la fabricación casera de ladrillos, ya que tiene su propia olería.
El señor Lorenzo es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha por dar a su hija todo lo que él no pudo tener, quiere que ella el día de mañana sea una buena profesional útil a la sociedad. La meta de Lorenzo también es ir agrandando su olería para poder ayudar a otras personas dando fuentes de trabajo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para su olería, como ser arcillas y demás.
texts.en:
Sr. Lorenzo is 56 years old and separated from his wife. He lives in the town of Villarrica. He is the father of a lovely daughter called Francisca whom he adores. He earns his living building houses as he owns a brick-making operation.

Lorenzo is a very hardworking person who works tirelessly to provide his daughter with everything that he couldn’t have. He wants her to get a good job in the future and become a useful member of society. His goal is also to continue growing his brick-making factory so that he can help other people by giving them jobs.

Lorenzo is grateful for this opportunity to ask for a loan to buy materials for his factory such as clay and other items.

loans.use: to buy clay for his brick-making operation

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SR DE HUANCA,la socia continua dedicandose a la agricultura y ganaderia,la socia lleva años dedicandose a estas actividades las cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose a la venta de verduras y crianza de animales menores siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.
La socia se siente feliz por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank "SR DE HUANCA" and she continues dedicated to farming and raising livestock.  She has been in business for several years and it has gone well because of the hard work she puts in daily.  She also continues to sell vegetables and raise small animals to earn enough income to support her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers for her cropland.  She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her cropland.

loans.name: Pin's Group

texts.en:
Age 41 and a citizen from Kampong Cham province, Pin is a local farmer who grows rice on one and a half hectares of land in order to support her four dependent children. To better feed the family, her husband also helps to earn extra income by working as a house builder. Having worked in her current business for 11 years, Pin is able to earn up to 24,400 KHR per day. 

This is the third time Pin's group, which consists of three members, has taken a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and Pin is the group's leader. She feels confident that she can maintain a good condition from her past loans which she has fully repaid already. Now, Pin and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR, while the third member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Pin will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to gain a high crop yield and sell at a higher price than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Amy has been in this business for 20 years now.

Amy requested a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment such as plywood, paints, light, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment such as plywood, paints, light, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
The mother of three school-aged children residing in Kampong Cham province, Lai is a rice grower on two hectares of land. To help her earn extra income, her husband also works for others during his spare time. Lai has been in her current business for 22 years and earns 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is not Lai's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has improved her living situation at a gradual pace. Now, Lai leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. The group members are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Lai will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay a plowing fee. She highly hopes that she can gain more yield and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Santusa nació en el departamento de Apurímac pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 
Santusa tiene 52 años de edad y es viuda pero tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de golosinas como por ejemplo chicles, galletas, gaseosas, chocolates y otras cosas, ella tiene un pequeño local en su domicilio donde expende sus productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como dulces y galletas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Santusa was born in the department of Apurímac but she lives in the city of Salvación (which is located in the district and province of Manu, in the department of Madre de Dios, Perú).

Santusa is 52, a widow and has five children.  She is a hard-working mother and entrepreneur who earns a living for her family by selling sweets such as chewing gum, cookies, sodas, chocolates and other items.  She has a small space in her home where she sells the products.  For several years now she has been in business and it is going well for her thanks to her hard work.

She belongs to the communal bank "Tesoritos del Manu" and on this occasion she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as sweets and cookies.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sweets and cookies.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Gantsooj

texts.en:
Gantsooj, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. His wife works as a nurse at a local hospital and his daughter goes to high school. His three-year-old son goes to kindergarten. Gantsooj, himself, has a position as a gas fitter at a filling station. 

The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. The house they live in has windows and walls that are vulnerable to strong storms and winds. So, Gantsooj is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase insulation materials such as fiberglass and foam. Using these materials he can insulate his house, thus providing warm and comfortable accommodation for his family. Gantsooj is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase insulation materials, such as fiberglass and foam, for his home

loans.name: Glorioso

texts.es: Glorioso tiene 50 años de edad, esta casaddo con Rogelia,cuenta con una casa propia, en donde viven solamente con su esposa.Glorioso se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo, hace 12 años que se dedica a este negocio junto a su esposa, viendo que las tierras de cultivo que tenían no producían, buscaron otra manera de generar ingresos y fue así que decidieron poner su actual negocio.Al principio tuvieron muchas dificultades por que sus ventas eran muy bajas y no rendía mucho, pero con el tiempo empezaron a surtir la bodega y se incrementarón las ventas. Lo que espera de de su trabajo es seguir teniendo utilidades e ir progresando para mejorar su calidad de vida .Este es el primer crédito con Kiva y esta muy contento por la oportunidad que se le brinda ya que le permite mejorar su negocio ,es por eso que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000.00 comprará mas productos para su negocio tales como arroz , azúcar , leche , fideos , entre otros .
texts.en:
Glorioso, 50, is married to Rogelia and they live in their own home.  He sells groceries from his house which is where his work center is located.  For 12 years he and his wife have been running this business.   The cropland they have was not productive so they looked for another way to generate an income and decided on a grocery store.  At first they had many difficulties because the sales volume was low but over time they increased their inventory and sales.

Glorioso hopes to continue making a profit and improve his quality of life.  This is his first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.  He will use the 2,000 PEN loan to buy more products such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, noodles, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ana Delsi

texts.es:
Doña Ana es una mujer emprendedora de 39 años de edad que junto a su esposo y sus tres pequeños hijos se dedican a la venta de granos básicos. Sus hijos estudian en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el tercer grado y no pudo continuar ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron seguirla apoyando. Ella se dedica al comercio hace mas de 20 años y fueron sus abuelos los que le enseñaron este negocio ya que es de tradición familiar mismo que ha sido medio de ingreso económico para ella y su familia desde hace muchos años. Ella se transporta en auto bus para el lugar de comercio y vender diariamente el cual esta ubicado a 20 minutos de sus casa de habitación. Como todo en la vida tiene un desafió el de ella es la competencia; pero dia a dia ella lucha lucha para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de un panel solar el cual lo ha anhelado desde hace mucho tiempo ya que en el lugar donde ella habita no hay energía eléctrica y considera que hoy en día es necesario tener iluminado su hogar por lo que durante mucho tiempo ella ha luchado con sus oficios domésticos y cotidianos en compañía de luz con candela comercial o/y luz con astillas de madera de pino.

Su sueño es levantarse temprano por la mañana y luego presionara el interruptor que iluminara su humilde hogar, también en sus hijos habrá un cambio trascendental ya que podrán estudiar y elaborar sus actividades estudiantiles en horas nocturnas.
texts.en:
Ana is a 39-year-old entrepreneur who sells basic grains, together with her husband and three children.  Her children are in different grades of elementary school.  She, herself, has a third grade education and was unable to go further because her parents had scarce economic resources and could not continue supporting her.  For over 20 years she has been a merchant, and it was her grandparents who taught her the trade.  For many years, this has been a family tradition and the main source of income for her and her family.

Every day she takes a bus to her salespoint which is about 20 minutes from her home.  Her main challenge is the competition; but day by day she struggles to put food on the table at home.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy a solar panel which she has been wanting for a long time.  There is no electric energy where she lives so she feels it is necessary to have lighting at home.  Until now she has been using commercial candle lighting or pine wood burners by which to do her housework.

Her dream would be to get up early in the morning and switch on the light in her humble home.  This will also be a great improvement for her children who will be able to study and carry out school activities at night.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: San Jose De Cuchuro Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “San Jose de Cuchuro” en la comunidad de Cuchuro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican al agricultura, venta de comida, ventad de manzanas, ganadería, crianza de pollos, crianza de animales menores y otros. 

Fortunata está levantando la mano en la fotografía, ella nació en la comunidad de Cuchuro y vive en la misma comunidad  a 2 horas de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella  tiene 27 años de edad y tiene tres hijos(Gilmer, Dani, Meymar de 9, 3 y 6 meses respectivamente), ella es una persona responsable y amable pues sus vecinos no dudaron en invitar a participar en el banco comunal, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comestibles y elaboración de pan, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde expende sus productos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina y otras cosas más. (La persona que aparece adjunta en la fotografia pidio permiso a la junta directiva para no estar presente el dia de la reunion por motivos de salud).  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends form the San Jose de Cuchuro communal bank in the Cuchuro community, Paucartambo province, Cusco department.  This communal bank is comprised of various people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead, and through their daily effort, to give their children a better future.  The members are farmers, sell food, sell apples, raise cattle, raise chickens, and raise small animals, and others.

Fortunata is raising her hand in the photograph.  She was born in the Cuchuro community, and she lives in the same community, which is two hours from the city of Paucartambo.  She is 27 years old, and she has three children (Gilmer is 9, Dani is 3, and Maymar is 6 months).  

She is a responsible and kind person.  Her neighbors did not hesitate to invite her to participate in the communal bank.  Fortunata has a small business selling food and making bread.  She has a small grocery store where she sells her products. She now needs a loan to buy supplies like flour and other things. (The person who appears in the photo attached to the left requested permission from the group to not be present the day of the payment meeting for health reasons.)

The members as a whole are grateful for the opportunity given to them, and they pledge to make their payments on the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour and other things.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y desde hace 25 años que radica en la ciudad de Salvación.  (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Maria Luisa tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella tiene un local de hospedaje, una tienda de abarrotes y un restaurante. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, tarros de leche y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
María Luisa was born in the city of Paucartambo but has lived in the city of Salvación for the last 25 years.  (The city of Salvación is located in Manu District, Manu Province which is in the Department of Madre de Dios, Peru).

María Luisa is 39-years-old and is in a common law relationship; she has two children.  She owns an inn, a grocery store and a restaurant.  She’s been in these businesses for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She’s an enterprising, hardworking woman who moves her family forward because she’s a member of the “Del Futuro del Manu” (Manu’s Future) communal bank.

On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, jugs of milk and other things, for example.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian nació en la ciudad de Challabamba pero ahora vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Fabian tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, él trabaja en una entidad pública y también se dedica a vender productos agro veterinarios, él tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad de Salvación. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo pesticidas, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Fabián was born in the city of Challabamba but now lives in the city of Salvación.  (The city of Salvación is located in Manu District in Manu Province within the Madre de Dios Department, Peru).

Fabián is 42-years-old, is in a common law relationship and has three children.  He works for a public firm and also sells agro-veterinary supplies.  He has a small stand in one of the popular markets in the city of Salvación.  He’s been in business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into it.  He’s belonged to the “Del Futuro del Manu” (Manu’s Future) communal bank for several years.  

On this occasion he needs the loan to buy more merchandise like pesticide, fertilizer and seeds, for example.  He is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like pesticide, fertilizer, seeds, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
A single woman, originally from Kampong Cham province, Hen is 28 years old. She strives to make a living via rice cultivation and cassava farming as the primary source of income. It is the business that she has been with for 13 years. 

This is the first microloan for Hen with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. Her requested loan amount is KHR 1,000,000, while her joint borrower is applying for a loan of KHR 500,000. 

As the group leader, Hen will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and weeding fees. She hopes to replant her cash-crop on time and to make a good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and weeding fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is single, 52 years old, and working hard to help her parents.

Cristita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.

Cristita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Cristita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen, 51 years old and married, is a resident of Kampong Cham province and a mother of four children. She does cassava farming on a one-hectare area, with support from her husband. This couple also works for others, for extra income, for the sake of family. From the current business, Yen is able to earn up to KHR 20,000 per day.  

Yen has never been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) before. She and the other two borrowers in Yen's Group are first-time borrowers. She and one of her joint members are seeking for KHR 600,000, while the remaining member is applying for a loan of KHR  400,000. 

As the leader, Yen will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland and to pay for weeding fees. She hopes to earn double-yield and to sell the crop at a high price, so she can set aside some money in order to build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farmland and to pay for weeding fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois a été créé  le 30 novembre 2009.
Il est constitué par les femmes du même village qui ont de bonnes relations. Elles font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche.
Tabaski est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 filles. Sur la photo elle est debout, à droite de la photo et levant la main. 
Avec le prêt reçu elle envisage de faire de l'embouche caprines. 
Elle va acheter 2 chèvres, l'une à 20000f pour revendre après engraissement entre 37500f et 45000f selon le prix du marché.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge la famille puisse qu'étant veuve elle s'en occupe toute seule.
texts.en:
This banc villageois has been created on November 30, 2009. It is composed of women from the same village who are on good terms with each other. They work as vendors and livestock farmers.

Tabaski is 53 years old. She is a widow and has six children, two of whom are daughters. On the photo she is standing on the right raising her hand. With this loan, she plans to raise goats. She will buy two goats at 20,000 West African francs each in order to fatten and resell them at 37,500-45,000 West African francs, depending on the going market price. Her revenues will allow her to support her family since, as a widow, she does that on her own.

loans.use: to buy two goats for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise like sod, palm trees, flower pots, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past eight years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small nursery school. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more furniture for the school and help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to put up a better school structure to attract more pupils. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more furniture for the school

loans.name: Nusula's Group

texts.en:
Nusula's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Nusula is 24 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past three years, Nusula has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, juice, cooking oil and beans. 

To help expand her business, Nusula has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize flour, rice, cooking oil and juice for the shop to sell, and will help Nusula to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Nusula hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a clothing business. 

Nusula is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, rice, cooking oil and juice for the shop to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to waterproof her house and paint the exterior.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est une veuve âgée de 54 ans, mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 23 et 35 ans et parmi lesquels  deux vont encore à l'école.Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 7 ans où elle vend des fruits  et des vivres secs(farine de manioc)en fonction des saisons. La durée moyenne de rotation de son stock est de 3 jours.elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit  pour mieux s'approvisionner en grande quantité ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle grandissante et d'accroître son bénéfice.Bénéfice qui lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de réinvestir dans son activité dans le but de l'agrandir car elle a pour ambition d'occuper la position de leader dans ce secteur d'activité.
texts.en: Bernadette is a 54 year old widow, mother to 3 children whose ages range between 23 and 35 years old and among whom two still go to school. She has been a shopkeeper in a local market for 7 years where she sells fruit and dried goods (manioc flour) according to the seasons. The average duration of the turnover of her stock is 3 days. She is again requesting a new loan to better stock up in large quantities which will allow her to better satisfy her growing clientele and grow her profits. These profits will allow her to meet the needs of her family and to reinvest in her business with the goal of expanding it as her ambition is to hold the position of leader in this business sector.

loans.use: To increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce is a married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.For five years he has been operating a saloon and he also charges phones at a fee. He started the business in order to supplement his farming activities that are seasonal. Inadequate capital is his major business challenge.His dreams are to educate his children, to buy a plot of land, and to build a residential house. His business plan is to have at least three outlets in different places. Wilberforce intends to use the loan to buy equipments to start another salon in the next trading center.

loans.use: to buy equipments to start another saloon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Daudah

texts.en:
Daudah is a Ugandan citizen aged 45,he is married and has   six children all attending school. He is a business man basically dealing in cattle keeping and also runs a diary in the neighboring trading center. He has been in the business for the last 20 years and says his main aim is to boost his income and send his six children to school. He has purposely applied for this loan to buy dairy cows and buy veterinary drugs to treat local breeds.   
He hopes to use this facility to buy Freisian bulls for cross breeding for better yields. He will then be able to pay for further studies for his six children.
Daudah confesses that his main challenge dealing with cattle and livestock is diseases like foot and mouth disease, as well as droughts that have run on for over eight months. However he is happy to have acquired six hectares of land which is now an extension of his grazing land. 
In the photograph is Daudah at his homestead. He is standing in the middle on the right is the loan officer and on the left is  his wife.

loans.use: To  buy high breed bulls  and veterinary drugs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en: Hillary is 50 years old, married and has six children who attend school. He owns a cattle-fattening business. He gets additional income from his coffee plantation. He works eight hours every day. He started the cattle-fattening business in 2000 with the aim of earning a better living and taking good care of his family's many needs. He sells the animals at a profit after fattening them for a period of six to 12 months. His clients are different people from the neighborhood who buy the  animals for slaughter. His dream is to buy plots in the nearby trading center and build rental houses which will help him pay university fees for his children without any difficulty.He would like to use the loan proceeds for buying some calves for fattening. His main challenge is that sometimes animals overstay in the farm and when that happens, he loses money. Hillary is a very hardworking and committed gentleman who respects his loan repayment dates. He appreciates the services of the bank and he acknowledges that it is through its financial support that he is what he is now.

loans.use: To buy calves for fattening

loans.name: Haruuna

texts.en:
Haruuna is 35 years old. He is married to Sofia and they have one child. They also take care of two widows--that is, wives of Haruuna's late brothers who died in a fire accident last year. Haruuna assists them with all their basic needs and also pays their children’s school fees from the small income he earns from his pineapple business.

He started his business in 2009 as a source of income since he is the sole breadwinner of his family. Thanks to this business, he is able to send his children to school: this is a priority for him since he never had an opportunity to go to school.He has managed the pineapple business because it doesn’t involve a lot of skills, though he has a dream of expanding his business by opening up other outlets. He has asked for 2,000,000 UGX to buy a piece of land.

Haruuna’s major challenge is lack of sufficient capital to boost his business and at the same time look after his family.
His neighbors applaud him as a very hardworking, determined and dedicated businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Cacildio

texts.pt:
Solteiro e não tem filhos, vive na casa própria e sustenta seu irmão que vive com ele.
É docente e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, portas, barrotes, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e continuar com os seus estudos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de se empenhar nos estudos para crescer profissionalmente concluindo o nível superior.
texts.en:
Cacildio is single and doesn't have any children. He lives in a house that he owns and supports his brother who lives with him.
He's a teacher. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, doors, beams, etc.) in order to continue building his house.
His wish for the future is to finish his house and to continue his studies. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is working hard on his studies in order to advance his career by getting his college degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, metal sheets, doors, beams, etc.) in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Eldard

texts.en:
Eldard is a permanent resident of Bukanga in the Isingiro district. He is married with eight children of his own and four dependants of his brother who died of malaria five years ago. He grew up with his single mother and it was a difficult childhood. Being pushed by the need to survive and to support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandmother. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family and as a source of income. This business has grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependants. He has managed to construct a house for his family. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to complete his house.
In the photgraph is Eldard and his wife.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 43-year-old man with a wife and 10 children. He deals in agriculture and mostly grows ginger, although he also grows beans and coffee. He has been farming since 1994. His clients are his fellow farmers who buy in bulk. He also runs a veterinary shop. He started the veterinary shop to supplement his income since he needs a lot to take care of his large family. He sells cereals and pesticides in his veterinary shop. His main challenge is the seasonal nature of his business. He hopes to buy more hectares of land to improve his ginger production. He also plans to educate all of his children. With this loan, he wants to buy pesticides for spraying his ginger  gardens.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for spraying his ginger gardens.

loans.name: Luci Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Marcia tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de abarrotes como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas, ella tiene un pequeño local en su domicilio donde expone sus productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Marcia was born and still lives in the city of Salvación, which is located in the district and province of Manu in the department of Madre de Dios, Peru.

Marcia, 42, is in a common-law marriage, from which she has one son. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who provides for her family. Her main business activity is selling groceries, for example rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other items. She has a small space in her home where she exhibits her products. She has already had this business for several years, and it is going well thanks to the effort which she puts into her work.

She is a member of the "Tesoritos del Manu” communal bank. On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar, noodles, and other products. She appreciates and values this loan and she is committed to paying her monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar, noodles, and other products.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Djiguisseme A Group

texts.fr:
Les  5 membres du groupe  Djiguissème  A sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Foh, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs, et  Lassina debout au milieu, compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Djiguissème A group are married men. On average, they are 37 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in Foh, one of the villages in Sikasso (the 3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season and this is their sixth loan with the institution. All their previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop they cultivate is maize. Lassina, pictured standing in the middle, intends to use his loan to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay the labour costs to maintain 2 hectares. After harvest, the produce is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso to both men and women customers. 

Lassina is hoping to make an average of 300,000 CFA francs per campaign. This money will help him pay off the loan and support his large family with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seed, and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Virginie Solange

texts.fr: Virginie est une femme de 34 ans célibataire et  mère de 2 enfants. Elle a ouvert un bar-restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 3 ans. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration ainsi que la boisson en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de casiers de boissons ainsi que de ses denrées alimentaires (sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Virginie is a 34-year old woman, single, with two children. She has opened a bar-restaurant she has been managing for three years now. This business allows her to provide for her family. Because she buys food and beverages retail, she does not have much of a profit margin left. This is why this loan is important for her business: it will allow her to stock up on cases of beverages as well as on food  items (some bags of peanuts, one bag of rice, a pallet of fish, meats, vegetables and various small items needed for cooking). This will allow to stop  doing her shopping daily and   reduce her taxi costs, which will also increase her revenues. She will reinvest part of her revenues in her business and use the rest to provide for family  needs.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages as well as food items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, and none of them attend school. She is also looking after two grandchildren.
She has been selling raw food like tomatoes, onions, and cassava in the market at retail for the last fifteen years, working seven days a week. She does not earn any additional income.

She has requested a loan of USh 600,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more food staffs like  more Irish potatoes,onions cassava and  tomatoes for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transport. Her dream is to acquire land, construct a building and shift her business there, and also to start growing some of the foodstuffs. She joined MCDT because of the convenient terms and the timely loans. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy more food stuffs like Irish potatoes  tomatoes, onions, and cassava.
